							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Approach]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<p class="first-practice-practice">Scarinci Hollenbeck employs a lifecycle philosophy and approach to counseling our clients. Our practice blends the broad perspective required to understand the apparent and subtle ramifications of decisions concerning the businesses of our clients, and the breadth of experience necessary to advise on the most sophisticated issues and applications of law.</p>
We utilize that understanding and experience in providing guidance and representation to our clients in areas such as mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, commercial finance, strategic alliances, joint ventures, technology transactions, licensing, employment, shareholder relations, equity and debt offerings, creditors’ rights, and numerous other complex fields where significant depth is essential. In that context, our clients rely on us to help resolve impediments, take advantage of opportunities, anticipate problems, and minimize surprises down the road.

In addition to the broad base of knowledge and experience our business law attorneys possess, we employ an interdisciplinary perspective and closely interact with the other practice groups throughout the firm to service our clients. Such an approach is vital, as structuring commercial transactions or counseling companies is rarely straightforward.

In that regard, our corporate attorneys are alert to <em>subtle tax ramifications requiring the advice of our firm’s tax attorneys, exposure of clients to environmental liability and working with our firm’s environmental group to assess and address such concerns, and circumstances which warrant consultation with our firm’s litigation team. </em>Working together, our practice groups seamlessly provide effective solutions for all of our clients’ corporate commercial concerns.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<h5 class="first-practice-practice">The corporate and commercial transactions services we provide to our clients encompass a number of areas, including:</h5>
<ul class="custom-inner-list">
 	<li>The formation, organization, ownership, control and dissolution of corporations, limited liability companies, partnerships, and joint ventures</li>
 	<li>Shareholder and operating agreements</li>
 	<li>Negotiation of contracts and agreements with vendors, suppliers, licensees, distributors, and other related entities</li>
 	<li>Representation of the parties to and financiers of mergers, acquisitions, leveraged buyouts, and other commercial restructurings</li>
 	<li>Corporate governance, management and control, and crisis management, including in connection with family run companies and close-corporations</li>
 	<li>Providing advice to majority and minority owners, partners, members, employees and other business participants, and dispute resolution among business owners</li>
 	<li>Representation of national and regional institutional lenders and borrowers in commercial lending transactions</li>
 	<li>Negotiation and counseling regarding labor relations and employment law</li>
 	<li>Public and private securities stock offerings Representation of creditors in bankruptcy and other contexts</li>
 	<li>Intellectual property counseling and the protection of proprietary rights</li>
 	<li>Technology and intellectual property transactions, including, but not limited to, collaboration agreements, joint development projects, technology transfers, licensing and computer law, strategic sourcing agreements and the procurement of computer systems. (For a more in-depth description, see our <a href="https://scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/technology-law/">Technology Law practice group page.</a></li>
</ul>]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Labor &amp; Employment</title>
		<link>https://staging.scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/labor-employment/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Jul 2019 17:35:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ptumulty]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://shlaw.staging.wpengine.com/?post_type=practices&#038;p=28271</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28271</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2019-07-17 13:35:53]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2019-07-17 17:35:53]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[labor-employment]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[practices]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[50]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:3:{i:0;s:5:"28270";i:1;s:5:"28276";i:2;s:5:"28292";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc07981e5362]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:1:{i:0;s:5:"28954";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079dee5368]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[It is indisputable that the challenges confronting business in the labor and employment arena will continue to become more substantial and complex. Scarinci Hollenbeck has developed and maintains the resources to address these significant and diverse challenges confronting our clients.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Approach]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Scarinci Hollenbeck provides<strong> advice and counsel with respect to all matters regarding employer/employee relations.</strong> We frequently counsel our clients with regard to issues concerning contract negotiations, the administration of<strong> labor agreements, disciplinary proceedings, grievance and public sector interest arbitrations and employment discrimination matters.</strong> Our attorneys also provide general advice and counsel, and present seminars and training sessions, with regard to employment policies, employee manuals, reductions in force and the establishment of employment practices and preventive programs which minimize the potential for litigation.

We regularly conduct seminars and customized training sessions for management and employees. Our training has been effective in implementing and reinforcing internal company policies, emphasizing compliance with existing law, and setting the tone for the workplace environment. Just some of the sessions we have conducted includes avoiding harassment in the workplace, ensuring compliance with the Family and Medical Leave Act, and the Open Public Records Act. Each training session given by Scarinci Hollenbeck is customized to include issues and concerns that are unique and important to each organization.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Areas of Service]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our attorneys are well versed in representing our employer clients in <strong>traditional labor law matters.</strong> These may include union organizing attempts, unfair labor practices, union grievance arbitrations and injunctive proceedings to halt unlawful strikes and illegal mass picketing. We have negotiated collective bargaining agreements in a variety of industries and with scores of unions, at both the employee and supervisory levels. We are equally experienced in representing our clients in matters involving individual contracts and early retirement agreements.

We <strong>counsel our clients on significant employment law matters </strong>involving the employer/employee relationship, such as Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act (ADEA), the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and the Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA). When litigation proves to be the only means to resolve a conflict, our labor and employment law attorneys work closely with the Litigation Group to develop an effective strategy to protect our client’s interests.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_2_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Representative Matters]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_2_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_2_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<ul class="custom-inner-list">
 	<li>Defense of allegations of <strong>sexual discrimination and harassment,</strong> including successful representation of businesses and their management alleging acts of sexual misconduct brought by current and former employees.</li>
 	<li>Defense of <strong>allegations of “Whistleblower”</strong> activity, including successful representation of business entities, governmental entities and their management alleging workplace harassment after alleged whistleblower activity.</li>
 	<li>Defense of allegations of race and ethnic discrimination and harassment, including successful representation of a College, its president and upper <strong>management alleging race discrimination</strong> brought by a former faculty member.</li>
 	<li>Defense of violations of federal American with <strong>Disabilities Act and state Law Against Discrimination.</strong></li>
 	<li>Represent employers against allegations of unfair labor practices and union grievances.</li>
 	<li>Defend and prosecution allegations of breach of employment contracts, violations of non-compete agreements and misappropriation of trade secrets.</li>
 	<li>Conduct and coordinate internal investigations relating to allegations of harassment and whistleblowing activities.</li>
 	<li>Conduct and coordinate internal investigations relating to allegations of employee theft and other employee criminal conduct.</li>
 	<li>Defense of <strong>allegations of violations of ERISA.</strong></li>
</ul>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_2_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[3]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>

					<item>
		<title>Environmental &amp; Land Use</title>
		<link>https://staging.scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/environmental-and-land-use/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Jul 2019 17:42:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ptumulty]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://shlaw.staging.wpengine.com/?post_type=practices&#038;p=28273</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28273</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2019-07-17 13:42:05]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2019-07-17 17:42:05]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc07981e5362]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our clients, coming to us from a range of industry groups, rely on our attorneys to provide them with innovative and strategic solutions to their most pressing environmental and land use issues.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Approach]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Scarinci Hollenbeck’s environmental and land use practice is one of the most experienced and well-respected in the region. The sophisticated legal skills, extensive experience and strong reputation of the attorneys that constitute the firm’s Environmental and Land Use Law Group has made us an integral participant in the development/redevelopment of industrial and commercial properties, brownfields redevelopment and energy and transportation infrastructure projects in New Jersey and throughout the New York Metropolitan area. Our clients, coming to us from a broad range of industry groups, rely on our attorneys to provide them with innovative and strategic solutions to their most pressing environmental and land use issues. We offer the full spectrum of services, from regulatory compliance counseling and management of environmental liabilities in corporate and financial transactions, to solid waste management and representation in civil, criminal and administrative proceedings.

We understand the impact that certain environmental regulations will have on our clients’ operations and have a strong track record of finding effective solutions for the challenging regulatory issues they face. We help our clients achieve and maintain compliance with all federal and state statutes and environmental programs, and we keep sight of new regulations that may impact their businesses down the road. Our work includes designing and implementing company-wide compliance and audit programs, helping businesses obtain permits and land development approvals from regulatory authorities and advising clients on solid waste and/or hazardous waste and substances management. We also work with lenders, investors and buyers to minimize or avoid liability for contaminated real estate.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Areas of Service]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Environmental &amp; Land Use</h5>
We provide advice and guidance in the area of land use for development and redevelopment within the requirements of local zoning ordinances and by-laws, conservation commissioners and a variety of local, state and federal permitting boards and regulators. We offer a full range of legal services to take our clients through the planning, approval and implementation phases of construction projects of all sizes and varieties. Our clients include developers, private industrial companies, power development companies, educational institutions, retailers and counties and municipalities.

Scarinci Hollenbeck has helped numerous clients resolve the complex environmental, regulatory and real estate issues associated with brownfields and industrial properties, where redevelopment is complicated by contamination problems. We work with buyers, sellers, lenders, developers and public and private entities and our practice covers the full range of business needs, from complete transactional support and the development of land use-based cleanup strategies through dispute resolution and litigation.
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Corporate  &amp; Real Estate Transactions</h5>
Attorneys in the Group are frequently consulted in connection with environmental issues affecting corporate transactions. Many transactions, from the sale or purchase of real property, to mergers and acquisitions, can introduce environmental risks and liabilities. We structure business, real estate, banking and corporate transactions to minimize environmental risks.
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Environmental &amp; Land Use</h5>
Our attorneys have significant experience in representing clients in environmental lawsuits in federal and state courts and in proceedings before administrative agency tribunals. We are capable of handling a broad range of environmental contamination and toxic tort claims, including remediation and litigation under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA), the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act (CERCLA or Superfund) and the New Jersey Spill Compensation and Control Act.
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Energy &amp; Utility Areas</h5>
Scarinci Hollenbeck attorneys have extensive experience working with clients in the energy and utilities areas, including:
<ul>
 	<li>Independent generation companies</li>
 	<li>Gas and petroleum product pipelines</li>
 	<li>Industrial customers</li>
 	<li>Municipalities</li>
 	<li>Lenders</li>
 	<li>Developers and contractors</li>
</ul>
Our practice encompasses:
<ul class="rep-matters-sports-practice">
 	<li>Transactions</li>
 	<li>Permitting and compliance</li>
 	<li>Federal and state regulatory proceedings</li>
 	<li>Energy sector restructuring and deregulation</li>
 	<li>Construction contracting</li>
 	<li>Litigation and legislative policy matters</li>
</ul>
We have assisted numerous clients in developing and implementing successful and expedient permit strategies for siting, construction and the operation of energy generation, transmission and distribution facilities.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>

					<item>
		<title>Litigation</title>
		<link>https://staging.scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/litigation/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Jul 2019 17:45:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ptumulty]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://shlaw.staging.wpengine.com/?post_type=practices&#038;p=28274</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28274</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2019-07-17 13:45:52]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2019-07-17 17:45:52]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[litigation]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[practices]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[50]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:13:{i:0;s:5:"28317";i:1;s:5:"28318";i:2;s:5:"28381";i:3;s:5:"28994";i:4;s:5:"28995";i:5;s:5:"28997";i:6;s:5:"28998";i:7;s:5:"28999";i:8;s:5:"29001";i:9;s:5:"28996";i:10;s:5:"29000";i:11;s:5:"29002";i:12;s:5:"29003";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc07981e5362]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:2:{i:0;s:5:"28937";i:1;s:5:"28936";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079dee5368]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Scarinci Hollenbeck’s New York, Washington D.C. and New Jersey Litigation attorneys are capable of representing clients in all types of general and commercial litigation, ranging from relatively simple contractual matters to litigation involving complex questions of law and fact.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Approach]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Litigation is, by its<strong> nature, stressful, time consuming and cost intensive.</strong> The clients for whom we regularly serve as litigation counsel<em> include Fortune 500 companies,</em> small, privately held businesses, as well as individuals and families. We believe that our sensitivity to the burdensome cost of litigation, coupled with the breadth of experience of our litigators and the resources we have assembled to support them, allows Scarinci Hollenbeck to respond to our clients’ particular needs and goals as few law firms can.

The firm’s litigation practice is comprised of highly qualified and experienced attorneys, including those Certified by the Supreme Court of New Jersey as Civil and Criminal trial attorneys, who are capable of representing clients in varied types of general, commercial, employment and criminal litigation, ranging from relatively simple contractual matters to litigation involving complex questions of law and fact. Our attorneys appear before <strong>State and Federal trial and appellate courts,</strong> as well as regulatory and administrative agencies at all levels. Our philosophy includes partnering with our litigation clients in order to strategize an end game, while always keeping the big picture in mind. We are goal oriented and we understand the emotional and economic importance of the litigation process to our clients. To that end each of our litigation attorneys are committed to timely, effective and honest communication with our clients during the entire course of our representation.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Areas of Service]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[In addition to our nationwide litigation experience representing businesses in sophisticated contract, construction and employment matters, we have successfully represented municipalities, other public entities, insurance carriers, their insureds, and private clients in many other areas of law, including legal and accounting professional liability, medical malpractice, construction defects and related surety and performance bond issues, commercial litigation, employment discrimination (L.A.D. and A.D.A.), products liability, Civil Rights §§ 1983 and 1985 and other Constitutional claims, environmental and general insurance coverage, <strong>E.R.I.S.A., first party C.E.R.C.L.A. and I.S.R.A.</strong> actions and general negligence. In the product liability area, we have successfully litigated claims involving Federal preemption, toxic torts, fabric flammability and asbestos exposure. We are proud to note that our litigators have been involved in many precedent setting cases regarding creditors’ rights, civil RICO and its applicability to bank customers, statutory immunity, arbitration, defamation and other significant issues.

We have extensive experience in insurance coverage litigation and have pursued claims in a wide range of insurance policies, including:
<ul class="custom-inner-list">
 	<li>Directors and Officers</li>
 	<li>Errors and Omissions</li>
 	<li>Employment Practices Liability Insurance</li>
 	<li>Surety and Performance Bond</li>
 	<li>Comprehensive General Liability</li>
 	<li>Legal Professional Errors and Omissions</li>
 	<li>Commercial Property and Casualty</li>
 	<li>Inland Marine and Business Auto</li>
</ul>
The Group also has significant experience in the area of commercial indemnification and its impact on insurance coverage issues.

Scarinci Hollenbeck also represents a diverse group of public and private entities with regard to workers compensation matters, including:
<ul class="custom-inner-list">
 	<li>municipalities,</li>
 	<li>boards of education,</li>
 	<li>insurance carriers,</li>
 	<li>third party administrators,</li>
 	<li>self-insured companies.</li>
</ul>
Our services are comprehensive and include all areas of workers compensation law. When handling claims, our objective is to provide the highest quality legal representation for all aspects of a claim in a cost-effective, expeditious manner. We work closely with each of our clients in implementing procedures to reduce costs and mitigate future risk and exposure. Once a decision is made to litigate a claim, we aggressively defend our clients’ interests in an effort to minimize losses.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_2_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Representative Matters]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_2_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_2_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<h4>Complex Contract & Transactional Litigation</h5>
<ul class="off-white pl-4 py-4">
 	<li>Successfully obtained denial of appeal before the Appellate Division following favorable decision of Board of Public Utilities approving merger of national cable television companies.</li>
 	<li>Construction litigation relating to design and build contracts and related subcontracts involving three petroleum storage tanks which failed after construction. Issues included engineering malpractice, breach of contract, and third party beneficiary claims.</li>
 	<li>Insurance coverage litigation relating to carriers’ denial of coverage of various Superstorm Sandy damage to property. Successful recovery of damages from carriers.</li>
 	<li>Construction contract litigation defending four million dollar claim against a trucking company resulting in a $400,000 judgment in favor of the trucking company.</li>
 	<li>Represented a solid waste company defending a claim by a governmental entity for contract reformation and declaratory relief resulting in a $2.78 million settlement award to client</li>
 	<li>Represented claims against a developer for breach of contract for commissions resulting in a $13 million judgment.</li>
 	<li>Defense of client in legal malpractice action in New Jersey’s first state case implicating its new e Discovery rule amendments.</li>
 	<li>Trust and Estate litigations including successful defense of allegations of undue influence.</li>
 	<li>Prosecute trademark infringement case against well-known television and cinema personality and publisher.</li>
 	<li>Led efforts in the United States in conjunction with Brazilian legal efforts relating to a significant data security breach including compelling cloud-based website to produce user information for use by international IT security firm in its investigation of highly confidential reports.</li>
 	<li>Secured removal from YouTube of video that disparaged client’s integrity and caused negative economic impact on its business.</li>
 	<li>Various significant foreclosure actions on behalf of creditors.</li>
 	<li>Various successful collections on accounts receivable on behalf of various business entities, including a national laboratory performing blood testing.</li>
 	<li>Successful litigation defending claims of environmental damages to property brought by neighboring property owner.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Complex Tort & Civil Rights Litigation</h4>
<ul class="off-white pl-4 py-4">
 	<li class="matter">Trial counsel in Federal and State courts on behalf of the State of New Jersey Legislative Reapportionment Commission successfully defending New Jersey’s legislative redistricting plan.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Counsel to the New Jersey Legislature relating to litigation relating to protection of legislators and staff pursuant to the Speech and Debate Clause of the New Jersey Constitution.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of federal litigation alleging wrongful death of individual in police custody.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of 911 call-takers and municipal government against allegations of negligence. Cases have become the seminal interpretations by the New Jersey Supreme Court of statutory immunity provided to call-takers and its relationship to other statutory tort immunities. Multiple cases resulting in the dismissal of claims against call-takers and their employers.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of governmental entity and individual police officers alleging wrongful death and civil rights violations relating to alleged failure to enforce a domestic violence restraining order. Successful appeal to Third Circuit Court of Appeals which reversed the District Court’s findings relating to the issue “state created danger” and property rights alleged to be established by restraining order.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of various Federal and State civil rights claims brought against municipalities, counties and State of New Jersey.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Successful litigation defending claims of environmental damages to property brought by neighboring property owner.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of prosecution of defamation cases including issues relating to applicability of reporter’s Shield Law privilege to internet bloggers.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of corporations against allegations of antitrust violations.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense and prosecution of business related torts, including violations of post employment non-compete agreements, interference with contract and misuse of confidential business information, including successfully obtaining restraining orders resulting in effectuation of contract provisions.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Secured removal from YouTube of video that disparaged client’s integrity and caused negative economic impact on its business.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Shareholders derivative lawsuit filed against a depository bank’s former and current officers and directors alleging corporate misconduct relating to $1.5 billion of deposits relating to money laundering allegations.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Significant experience in defending and prosecuting complex Workers Compensation and State Disability Pensions.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Litigation relating to nuisance, damage and trespass relating to dispute concerning storm water runoff.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Labor & Employment Litigation</h4>
<ul class="off-white pl-4 py-4">
 	<li class="matter">Defense of allegations of sexual discrimination and harassment, including successful representation of businesses and their management alleging acts of sexual misconduct brought by current and former employees.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of allegations of “Whistleblower” activity, including successful representation of business entities, governmental entities and their management alleging workplace harassment after alleged whistleblower activity.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of allegations of race and ethnic discrimination and harassment, including successful representation of a College, its president and upper management alleging race discrimination brought by a former faculty member.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of violations of federal American with Disabilities Act and state Law Against Discrimination.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Represent employers against allegations of unfair labor practices and union grievances.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defend and prosecution allegations of breach of employment contracts, violations of non-compete agreements and misappropriation of trade secrets.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Conduct and coordinate internal investigations relating to allegations of harassment and whistleblowing activities.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Conduct and coordinate internal investigations relating to allegations of employee theft and other employee criminal conduct.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense of allegations of violations of ERISA.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Criminal Defense Litigation</h4>
<ul class="off-white pl-4 py-4">
 	<li class="matter">Successful defense of corporate entity against allegations of federal bank fraud.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Successful defense of criminal allegations of “shaken baby” syndrome.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Successful defense of federal and state Racketeering (RICO) indictments.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Successful defense of public officials investigated and charged with official corruption.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Successful defense of federal stock fraud indictments.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Successful defense of federal and state tax related indictments.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Successful defense of computer related sex offenses.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Representation of physicians and accountants before regulatory boards relating to allegations of misconduct brought by the Office of the Attorney General.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Representation of corporations and individuals before State and Federal Grand Juries.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Representation of corporations and individuals in quasi-criminal litigation brought by the State of New Jersey, Division of Consumer Affairs.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Representation of individuals charged with serious violent crimes including homicide, arson and sex crimes.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Representation of individuals charged with drug related offenses.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Representation of individuals charged with DWI, other motor vehicle offenses, disorderly persons offenses and violations of municipal ordinances.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Estate & Trust Litigation</h4>
<ul class="off-white pl-4 py-4">
 	<li class="matter">Competency disputes</li>
 	<li class="matter">Wills and Trust disputes</li>
 	<li class="matter">Litigation on behalf of estates</li>
 	<li class="matter">Allegations of undue influence</li>
 	<li class="matter">Defense or prosecutions of allegations of misconduct by Trustees and Executors</li>
 	<li class="matter">Misappropriation of estate and trust assets</li>
</ul>
<h4>Business Tort Litigation</h4>
<ul class="off-white pl-4 py-4">
 	<li class="matter">Copyright and patent infringement</li>
 	<li class="matter">Business defamation</li>
 	<li class="matter">Appropriation of trade secrets</li>
 	<li class="matter">Enforcement of employee contracts and non-compete agreements</li>
 	<li class="matter">Statutory and common law antitrust violations; Our attorneys include a former state antitrust prosecutor.</li>
 	<li class="matter">Interference with prospective business advantage</li>
 	<li class="matter">Interference with contractual relationships</li>
 	<li class="matter">Emergency court applications to protect business from immediate and irreparable harm.</li>
</ul>]]></wp:meta_value>

		<title>Public Law</title>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Approach]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[We are proud of the high level of recognition our public practice has achieved throughout the State. Over the years, the firm has had the opportunity of working with some of the largest municipalities and counties in the State, as well as school districts, numerous planning and zoning boards, economic development authorities, utility authorities, and other public entities at every level of municipal, county and state government.

Our approach to public sector practice, together with our diversity of experience, allows us to provide our clients with comprehensive and cost effective services across several disciplines of public law practice.

The legal issues facing public entities today continue to increase in complexity and significance. At the same time, budgetary constraints require that our public sector clients become increasingly sensitive to all public expenditures, including the cost of securing competent legal representation.

With these issues in mind, we have developed our public law practice with the expertise and specialization necessary to serve our public sector clients in a cost-effective and professional manner. We apply this approach in our work on the behalf of the numerous public sector clients we represent.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Areas of Service]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our public law practice is comprised of several, specialized sub-groups which focus on particular areas of public entity representation. Some of these areas include
<ul class="custom-inner-list">
 	<li>Public bidding;</li>
 	<li>Contracting and related procurements;</li>
 	<li>Secondary, higher and specialized education;</li>
 	<li>The defense of tax appeals before county tax boards and in the New Jersey Tax Court;</li>
 	<li>Labor and employment matters;</li>
 	<li>Every aspect of education law, including:
<ul class="mt-3">
 	<li>Providing advice and counsel on all matters verbally and in writing within 24 hours, when needed and generally return telephone calls within the hour;</li>
 	<li>Providing advisory opinions and legal research when requested;</li>
 	<li>Preparing legal documents;</li>
 	<li>Attending Board meetings, committee meetings or meetings with third parties;</li>
 	<li>Providing written legal opinions when requested;</li>
 	<li>Reviewing and Preparing Board resolutions and motions, policies and regulations;</li>
 	<li>Initiating or defending lawsuits at the discretion of the Board;</li>
 	<li>Representing the Board in judicial and administrative proceedings where the district, board members, administrators or agents may be a party or have an interest;</li>
 	<li>Reviewing and advising the district in areas of service contract, procurement, bidding specifications and bidding matters, contract preparation and remedies for contractual disputes;</li>
 	<li>Working cooperatively with legal counsel of insurance companies, and providing assurance statements as requested for bonding matters and financial audits; and</li>
 	<li>Providing advice and representation on every other matter assigned by the Board.</li>
 	<li>Tenure dismissals</li>
 	<li>Bullying hearings</li>
 	<li>Residency Disputes</li>
</ul>
</li>
 	<li>Urban redevelopment;</li>
</ul>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079bee5365]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[include_attorney]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:27:{i:0;s:5:"28371";i:1;s:5:"28390";i:2;s:5:"28413";i:3;s:5:"28445";i:4;s:5:"28910";i:5;s:5:"29168";i:6;s:5:"28914";i:7;s:5:"28919";i:8;s:5:"28920";i:9;s:5:"28922";i:10;s:5:"28925";i:11;s:5:"28931";i:12;s:5:"28929";i:13;s:5:"29169";i:14;s:5:"28935";i:15;s:5:"28945";i:16;s:5:"28949";i:17;s:5:"29172";i:18;s:5:"28947";i:19;s:5:"28954";i:20;s:5:"28958";i:21;s:5:"28959";i:22;s:5:"28961";i:23;s:5:"29174";i:24;s:5:"28965";i:25;s:5:"29175";i:26;s:5:"28967";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

					<item>
		<title>Financing Group</title>
		<link>https://staging.scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/financing-group/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Jul 2019 18:15:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ptumulty]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://shlaw.staging.wpengine.com/?post_type=practices&#038;p=28282</guid>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The lawyers comprising the Financing group at Scarinci Hollenbeck provide sophisticated counseling and result-oriented representation to clients both large and small in a great variety of financing transactions.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Approach]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The attorneys in the financing group focus on delivering practical and cost effective legal services of the highest quality to international, national and regional banks, local lenders, institutional and private investors, entrepreneurs, developers, and real estate owners and operators of all types.

Our clients also rely on us to provide practical advice as to various rights and remedies which may exist for document covenant violations and loan defaults. In instances where loan problems cannot be resolved amicably, our lawyers work with our skilled litigators in the prosecution of foreclosure actions, as well as note collection suits and guarantor litigation.
<h3><strong>Areas of Service</strong></h3>
We regularly represent clients in:
<ul class="custom-inner-list">
 	<li>Construction,</li>
 	<li>Permanent and term financing transactions for commercial, industrial, and residential projects,</li>
 	<li>Leasehold financing matters,</li>
 	<li>Loan participations,</li>
 	<li>Subordinated loan financings,</li>
 	<li>Business capital loans,</li>
 	<li>Assignment and assumption transactions,</li>
 	<li>Loan modifications and extensions,</li>
 	<li>Loan workout transactions,</li>
 	<li>Personal property asset based financings,</li>
 	<li>Condominium and cooperative loans,</li>
 	<li>and intra-family loans.</li>
</ul>
Such representation includes the drafting, review, and negotiation of loan documents, assembly and review of due diligence materials, counseling on the many issues raised in the financing process, resolution of title insurance issues, and completion of all tasks necessary for closing.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>

					<item>
		<title>Healthcare &amp; Hospital Law</title>
		<link>https://staging.scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/health-and-hospital-law/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Jul 2019 18:18:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ptumulty]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://shlaw.staging.wpengine.com/?post_type=practices&#038;p=28283</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28283</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2019-07-17 14:18:45]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2019-07-17 18:18:45]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[health-and-hospital-law]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[practices]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[50]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc07981e5362]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079dee5368]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The health care industry faces many unique challenges. Our attorneys have sophisticated knowledge of the health care industry and can help our clients make informed business decisions, properly structure transactions and design solutions that comply with complex legislative and regulatory mandates.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Areas of Service]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Scarinci Hollenbeck’s Health Care and Hospital Law Group provides a comprehensive range of legal services to a broad spectrum of health care organizations. The firm has worked with hospitals and hospital systems, teaching hospitals, medical staffs, long-term care facilities, retirement and assisted living facilities, ambulatory care and surgery facilities, health maintenance organizations and other managed care organizations, multi-specialty group practices, management services organizations, independent practice associations, individual practitioners, insurance companies and other health care providers and entities.

Our services encompass the spectrum of legal services necessary to handle virtually any issue that may arise in this complex and highly regulated field. Some of the areas in which we assist our health care clients include:
<ul>
 	<li>Administrative and Civil Health Care Litigation</li>
 	<li>Antitrust</li>
 	<li>Business Transactions</li>
 	<li>Certificate of Need and Facility Licensure Issues</li>
 	<li>Compliance Counseling and Defense</li>
 	<li>Environmental Issues</li>
 	<li>Fraud and Abuse</li>
 	<li>Guardianships and Related Proceedings</li>
 	<li>Health Care Bond Financing and Lending Transactions</li>
 	<li>Health Care Real Estate and Leasing Transactions</li>
 	<li>Joint Ventures and Affiliations</li>
 	<li>Labor and Employment</li>
 	<li>Land Use Matters</li>
 	<li>Managed Care/Integrated Delivery Systems</li>
 	<li>Medicare and Third-Party Reimbursement</li>
 	<li>Physician Contracting Issues</li>
 	<li>Privacy and HIPAA Compliance</li>
 	<li>Professional Board Complaints and Actions</li>
 	<li>Professional Liability and Malpractice Defense</li>
 	<li>State and Federal Regulatory Issues</li>
 	<li>Tax and Tax-Exempt Counseling</li>
</ul>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>

		<title>Investment Banking</title>
		<link>https://staging.scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/investment-banking/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Jul 2019 18:20:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ptumulty]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://shlaw.staging.wpengine.com/?post_type=practices&#038;p=28284</guid>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Scarinci Hollenbeck attorneys in this Group have been lead counsel in hundreds of securities offerings, including representing many companies, underwriters, and selling group members in initial public offerings and follow-on offerings.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Experience]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[We regularly represent issuers in equity and debt capital raising transactions, including seed, angel, mezzanine, and venture capital financings, as well as in mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, and spinoff transactions.

We have often served as counsel to broker-dealer placement agents, venture capitalists, private equity funds, and investment bankers, including a number of New York Stock Exchange member firms. We have been general counsel and securities counsel to many publicly traded companies, representing them in financing activities and corporate governance and disclosure matters, as well as acting as general counsel to stock brokerage and investment banking firms, and to registered representatives and investment advisors. In this capacity, we have represented them in capital raising transactions and with regard to their registrations and filings with SEC, FINRA and state regulators.

Our numerous publications have appeared in professional and national newspapers and magazines regarding our experience in going public transactions, reverse mergers into public entities, private placements, convertible debt offerings, warrant exchange offerings, securities exchange listings and de-listings. We have lectured on a number of subjects related to the investment banking industry in professional continuing legal education courses, at FINRA and in the graduate school setting, in addition to “talking head” appearances on national television and nationally syndicated radio programs.

For additional information about our corporate and securities practice, see <a href="https://scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/securities-offerings-and-corporate-disclosure/">Securities Offerings and Corporate Disclosure</a>.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

					<item>
		<title>Joint Ventures</title>
		<link>https://staging.scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/joint-ventures/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Jul 2019 19:32:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ptumulty]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://shlaw.staging.wpengine.com/?post_type=practices&#038;p=28285</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28285</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2019-07-17 15:32:46]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2019-07-17 19:32:46]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[joint-ventures]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[practices]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
														<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[50]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc07981e5362]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_section_chief]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079dee5368]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our attorneys understand that their are different goals and expectations when it comes to joint ventures.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Joint Venture Agreements]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The members of any joint venture often have different goals and expectations for their participation in the entity. In most cases, these are based upon what they are required initially to contribute. However, regardless of the disparate positions of each member, the basic contract clauses which will control, reflect, and execute these expectations are the same in each operational agreement.

<strong>These are:</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>Funds in</li>
 	<li>Funds out</li>
 	<li>Additional equity requirements</li>
 	<li>Management and control</li>
 	<li>Buy-sell rights</li>
 	<li>Rights to transfer interests</li>
 	<li>Dissolution</li>
 	<li>These are simple terms which, however, will be reflected in sophisticated clauses each of which then lead to a waterfall of form and structure within a cohesive document.</li>
</ul>
The drafting of that document and any additional agreements necessary to support and/or supplement language thereof are handled within this sub-group.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079bee5365]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_include_attorney]]></wp:meta_key>

					<item>
		<title>Intellectual Property</title>
		<link>https://staging.scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/intellectual-property/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 17 Jul 2019 17:39:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ptumulty]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://shlaw.staging.wpengine.com/?post_type=practices&#038;p=28272</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28972</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2019-07-17 13:39:59]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2019-07-17 17:39:59]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[intellectual-property]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:10:{i:0;s:5:"28331";i:1;s:5:"28336";i:2;s:5:"28338";i:3;s:5:"29004";i:4;s:5:"28270";i:5;s:5:"29005";i:6;s:5:"29002";i:7;s:5:"28982";i:8;s:5:"29006";i:9;s:5:"28344";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_child_practice]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc07981e5362]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The attorneys in our Intellectual Property (“IP”) group handle the full spectrum of Intellectual Property (IP) matters. We assist clients nationally and throughout the world by securing, enforcing, and leveraging intellectual property rights wherever needed and however possible.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_description]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079b4e5364]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Approach]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The attorneys in this practice group include members of the Patent Bar, litigators, and true business and legal problem-solvers. We recognize that our clients’ trademarks, patents, copyrights, proprietary technology, and trade secrets are among their most valuable assets and that securing the protection of such IP will ensure long-lasting benefits.

We advise and represent companies of all sizes, worldwide, who are seeking to maximize, maintain, and protect their intellectual property portfolios. We represent individuals and corporate clients, providing access to full-service, business-driven dynamic IP counseling that evolves with the globally changing IP environment. The firm handles all aspects of domestic and international IP matters, including trademarks, copyrights, patents, IP enforcement and defense, IP licenses and agreements, domain names, software services, counterfeit protection, unfair competition, and IP counseling and audit services. We help clients manage their IP while developing practical and creative solutions that secure their property and information at home and around the world.

We help facilitate our clients’ exploitation of their intellectual property rights through various licensing and joint venture arrangements. We also counsel clients regarding the validity and valuation of intellectual property, mergers and acquisitions, and asset purchases. When necessary, our experienced attorneys are always prepared to enforce and protect our clients’ IP rights through litigation in jurisdictions across the United States, and in conjunction with foreign counsel throughout the world.

Even more, we handle insurance coverage matters on issues including Advertising Injury, Copyright Infringement, Trademark Infringement, Patent Infringement, Trade Dress (Packaging) Infringement, and Misappropriation of Trade Secrets and Confidential Information.
<h5>TAILORED SOLUTIONS — COMPETITIVE PRICES</h5>
Intellectual property law is at the core of many business transactions and strategic disputes and is one of the most critical legal areas as companies continue to expand and protect their technologies, brands, products, data and services throughout the world. Our attorneys help our clients to identify, prioritize and protect their core and expanding interests with trademark filings, patent filings, and other appropriate protective and growth measures.

The firm represents clients in an array of industries. The intellectual property needs of retail clients, designers, writers, musicians, and artists, inventors, hospitality providers, consumer goods companies, e-commerce platforms, and software developers differ. Additionally, depending on a company's stage of development, the intellectual property protections and plans required will also differ. In light of this, the firm advises clients by providing business-tailored recommendations and protection plan options, along with a spectrum of intellectual property considerations which are essential in a given context.

The firm is deeply committed to ensuring that startups and small companies in all industries have access to reasonably priced intellectual property protection. As such, Scarinci Hollenbeck offers startup clients fixed fees, capped fees and structured payments when appropriate. By ensuring that clients are protected at the outset, the firm builds lasting relationships with companies that will continue to rely on the firm's services as they grow and evolve. The firm is open to non-traditional payment arrangements under a variety of circumstances.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Areas of Service]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<h5>COPYRIGHTS</h5>
Our copyright practice spans all areas of the performing and visual arts, including works related to musical compositions, computer software, media arts, written works, paintings, photography, and others.

We draft and negotiate licensing and royalty agreements, fair use, and rights of publicity issues. We counsel clients on securing copyright protection in the United States and abroad and provide litigation services to protect and defend clients’ creative works. Our attorneys facilitate the exploitation of our clients’ copyrights through licensing and royalty agreements to ensure that our clients realize the full benefits of their creative endeavors. We also advise clients on issues pertaining to copyright fair use, rights of publicity, and copyright infringement concerns.
<h5>IP/TECHNOLOGY</h5>
We provide strategic advice to our clients with respect to IP and technology matters that arise from licensing, collaboration, research and development activities. This includes issues including the scope of their licenses, revocability and/or transferability of applicable agreements, the effect of corporate structure on such activities and bankruptcy-related issues affecting their rights under such agreements and succession rights as to such IP.
<h5>PORTFOLIO MANAGEMENT AND TRANSACTION ASPECTS</h5>
Trademark Prosecution is a notable aspect of the legal services we provide. In that regard, our attorneys have vast experience in obtaining and prosecuting word, design, and product configuration trademarks in the United States Patent and Trademark Office. We also aid clients in policing their trademarks and have successfully obstructed hundreds of infringers from selling counterfeit or unauthorized goods bearing our clients’ trademarks all around the world.

We handle all types of intellectual property transactions, and manage extensive trademark portfolios for domestic and international clients. As part of this service, we help clients of all sizes with acquisitions, divestitures, licensing, investments, and strategic planning. These include non-disclosure agreements, distribution agreements, joint venture agreements, manufacturing agreements, and endorsement agreements. Our attorneys are also experienced in preparing, structuring, and negotiating trademark, copyright, and patent license agreements, as well as technology development agreements.
<h5>PATENTS</h5>
We assist clients in securing and managing patent rights for their inventions and designs and designs. We provide clients with patent availability searches and “freedom to operate” reports. We also file and fully prosecute provisional and non-provisional patents with the United States Patent and Trademark Office.
<h5>LITIGATION</h5>
We have represented both plaintiffs and defendants in trademark, copyright and patent infringement actions, trade secret disputes, contract breaches and general business litigation clients in Federal and State Courts across the country, as well as in the Trademark Trial and Appeal Board. We have obtained nationally recognized precedential verdicts and decisions for our clients, as well as achieved favorable settlements.
<h5>IP CONSULTING</h5>
Real intellectual property protection is more than securing patents, copyrights, or trademarks. Though these aspects of IP law are essential, true protection allows products, companies, ideas and software to grow while IP protection evolves to protect existing and derivative products and works.

<a href="https://scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/ip-consulting/">Scarinci Hollenbeck's IP Consulting Practice</a>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079d2e5367]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_2_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Representative Matters]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_content_section_2_title]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cc079cde5366]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_2_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our seasoned lawyers have vast experience in litigation over a range of issues in federal, state and administrative jurisdictions all around the country. Over the years, they have been involved in many of the paramount cases involving the music and musical instrument business, and other creative industries, and have had success in achieving favorable outcomes for clients again and again.
<ul>
 	<li><strong>(Trademark Trial and Appeal Board, USPTO)</strong> Represented numerous guitar manufacturers in one of the largest United States trademark oppositions to applicant’s registration for product configuration trademarks in three guitar body shapes. Successfully opposed Applicant’s registrations by proving that the body shapes were not distinctive and had become generic. No appeal was made to this precedential TTAB decision.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Southern District of New York)</strong> Represented client in consolidated cases over federal trademark infringement. Successfully had opponent’s declaratory judgment case transferred from California to New York on grounds that opponent made an improper anticipatory filing before our client filed a federal trademark infringement lawsuit. During discovery, negotiated a substantial favorable settlement for client.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, District of New Jersey)</strong> Represented musical instrument manufacturer in a patent and trademark infringement lawsuit against audio equipment manufacturer. Obtained favorable settlement for Plaintiffs.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Central District of California)</strong> Represented musical instrument manufacturer against audio accessory manufacturer in federal and common law trademark infringement suit. Obtained favorable settlement for client after start of trial.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Western District of North Carolina)</strong> Represented Defendants in trademark ownership dispute for marks federally owned by Defendants and passed down to Plaintiff by testamentary instrument. Obtained dismissal for lack of personal jurisdiction, improper venue and insufficient service of process. Decision was not appealed.</li>
 	<li><strong>(NJ Superior Court)</strong> Represented founding band member and shareholder in a precedential suit against other band members and the corporate entity for breach of shareholder agreement and for failure to distribute profits. Obtained both money damages and attorney’s fees.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Middle District of Florida)</strong> Represented a US musical instrument distribution company in a precedential lawsuit against a foreign musical instrument manufacturer for breach of distribution contract. Successfully defeated a motion to dismiss for lack of jurisdiction and negotiated favorable settlement for client.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Central District of California)</strong> Successfully defended toy manufacturer in product configuration trademark infringement lawsuit by prominent doll manufacturer.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Eastern District of New York)</strong> Successfully obtained dismissal for clients – studio, producer and engineer – in landmark music sampling litigation.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Central District of California)</strong> Obtained favorable post mediation settlement for plaintiff in suit over unauthorized use of music instrument manufacturer’s federally registered trademarks on clothing.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Southern District of New York)</strong> Successfully defended clients sued by giant entertainment conglomerate and achieved favorable settlement from Plaintiffs for copyright infringement.</li>
 	<li><strong>(Trademark Trail and Appeal Board, USPTO)</strong> Successfully fought in the Trademark Trials and Appeals Board to recover and secure federal trademark registration for the name for one of the founding rock bands from the 1950’s.</li>
 	<li><strong>(United States District Court, Northern District of New York)</strong> Successfully defended foreign custom guitar parts builder in trademark litigation against large guitar manufacturer.</li>
</ul>]]></wp:meta_value>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_highlight_scroller_9_image]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[field_5cd4362d78965]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_0_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The estate planning services we provide includes the preparation of trusts and wills, structuring gift giving programs, planning for the disposition of insurance proceeds and retirement plan benefits, and coordinating arrangements for family business interests. The combined knowledge or our tax attorneys allows them to effectively utilize innovative tax planning techniques, particularly in personal income, tax and estate planning for entrepreneurs and high net-worth individuals.
<p class="tax-item-spacing">In the area of lifetime planning, we counsel individuals and their families on the issues of elder care, including preserving personal and closely-held business assets when faced with the extraordinary costs of long-term custodial care, coordinating private retirement and medical insurance benefits to ensure financial security, and avoiding costly court proceedings in the event of physical or mental incapacity.</p>

<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Business &amp; Corporate Tax</h5>
Corporate taxation although inherently complex is an integral and essential part of the short, intermediate and long term vision of any business. Tax planning represents an opportunity to improve profits and the return on capital, increase cash flow and avoid unexpected impositions (penalties) for failing to observe the rules.
<p class="tax-item-spacing"><a href="https://scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/business-corporate-tax-planning/">Business &amp; Corporate Tax Planning Practice</a></p>

<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Representation Before Taxing Authorities</h5>
Our attorneys provide advice to clients at all stages of an examination at the federal or state levels. We have tremendous experience in representing taxpayers in examinations, appeals and in court, if necessary.
<p class="tax-item-spacing"><a href="https://scarincihollenbeck.com/practices/representation-before-taxing-authorities/">Representation before Taxing Authorities Practice</a></p>
<strong>Additional Areas of Tax Law Scarinci Hollenbeck Attorneys can assist you or your business.</strong>
<ul>
 	<li>
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Audit Representation</h5>
</li>
 	<li>
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Civil Tax Controversy</h5>
</li>
 	<li>
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Crimintal Tax Defense</h5>
</li>
 	<li>
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Lien, Levy & Tax Collection Matters</h5>
</li>
 	<li>
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Offshore Voluntary Disclosures</h5>
</li>
 	<li>
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Domestic Voluntary Disclosure</h5>
</li>
 	<li>
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Estate Administration</h5>
</li>
 	<li>
<h5 class="mt-2 mb-1">Change of Domicile/Move to Florida</h5>
</li>
</ul>]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[content_section_1_content]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The Tax, Trusts, &amp; Estates attorneys at Scarinci Hollenbeck provide highly-personalized, responsive service to its clients as they counsel them at all the critical stages of their lives. Our years of experience and unparalleled knowledge in the areas of tax and estate planning allows us to plan for the least possible tax burden and administrative expense while maintaining maximum flexibility to realize each one of our client’s unique objectives.

Scarinci Hollenbeck’s experience in the area of tax law is comprehensive and covers the complete range of tax requirements involved in the structure, operation, succession, sale, acquisition, and ownership of privately and publicly owned business entities. Our attorneys advise their business and individual clients on the tax efficient structuring of organizations and transactions and represent clients in administrative proceedings before the Internal Revenue Service and other governmental agencies. We practice before all courts, including the United States Tax Court.

We work with individuals, such as corporate directors, executives, business owners, high net-worth individuals, and entrepreneurs involved in start-up businesses. We have a strong closely-held business practice with a large amount of experience addressing the special concerns facing family businesses, including the often fragile and complicated task of facilitating the transfer of the business to succeeding generations.]]></wp:meta_value>
